page.title: 02 COTHILL-VILLAGE SURVEY
page.content: Cothill is a small village consisting of approximately 15 houses,a post office(general stores),a chapel and a private school . POPULATION has increased slightly over the last 20 years.Signs on HOUSING showed dates from 1626 to 1973. Residents who had lived there all of their lives,felt LIFESTYLES had changed little. The most common SOCIAL CONCERNS were for:roads to be resurfaced;speed and weight limits for vehicles to be reduced;better street lighing,drainage and wider pavements;a gas supply;and a vicar for their chapel. Many would like to have seen the "Fleur de Lys" pub. reopened,after nearly 2 years closed. (Angela Bleach,Sally Guyancourt,Nicola Price and Joanne Smith).
